intro: Antirrhinum linkianum subsp. cirrhigerum, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
